turtle

Class Turtle

  • java.lang.Object
    • turtle.Turtle

  • public class Turtle
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that represents a turtle object. The turtle lives in the playground window where it draws traces when it moves. Serveral turtles can live in harmony with each other. When the turtle moves, they are overlayed, e.g. the current moving turtles is shown "on top" of other others. The size of the turtle sprites is dynamically adapted to the current device resolution,

    Each turtle has an individual speed in the range 0..10 or MAXSPEED (=-1). For speeds 1..10 the turtle movement (forward, back, left, right) is animated. The trace qualitiy may suffer a little bit when speed is small because of pixel rounding errors, so for best quality use MAXSPEED.

    All methods are thread-safe.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Turtle()
      Creates a white turtle using the following defaults:
      - Turtle color white
      - Position (0, 0), center of playground
      - Pen color white
      - Heading north
      Turtle(double x, double y)
      Creates a white turtle at given position using the following other defaults:
      - Pen color white
      - Heading north
      Turtle(double x, double y, int color)
      Creates a turtle with given color at given position using the following other defaults:
      - Pen color white
      - Heading north
      Turtle(int color)
      Creates a turtle with given color using the following other defaults:
      - Position (0, 0), center of playground
      - Pen color white
      - Heading north

        - Turtle color white
        - Position (0, 0), center of playground
        - Pen color white
        - Heading north

      • Turtle

        public Turtle(int color)
        Creates a turtle with given color using the following other defaults:
        - Position (0, 0), center of playground
        - Pen color white
        - Heading north
        Parameters:
        color - the initial color of the turtle (may be Color.TRANSPARENT to make the turtle invisible from the beginning)

      • Turtle

        public Turtle(double x,
      double y)
        Creates a white turtle at given position using the following other defaults:
        - Pen color white
        - Heading north
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the creation position
        y - the y coordinate of the creation position

      double y,
      int color)
        Creates a turtle with given color at given position using the following other defaults:
        - Pen color white
        - Heading north
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the creation position
        y - the y coordinate of the creation position
        color - the initial color of the turtle (may be Color.TRANSPARENT to make the turtle invisible from the beginning)

    • Method Detail

      • setSpeed

        public Turtle setSpeed(int speed)
        Sets the turtle's speed.
        0: stopped 1..10: speed values for the moving animation MAXSPEED (= -1) : no animation, maximal speed
        Parameters:
        speed - the speed of the turtle (0..10, MAXSPEED)
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • getSpeed

        public int getSpeed()
        Returns the current speed (0..10, -1 for MAXSPEED).
        Returns:
        the current speed

      • forward

        public Turtle forward(double s)
        Moves the turtle forward. s in turtle coordinates (coordinate system x = -200..200 to right, y = -200..200 upward).
        Parameters:
        s - the step to move forward, if s < 0 moves back
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • fd

        public Turtle fd(double s)
        Short for forward().

      • back

        public Turtle back(double s)
        Moves the turtle back. s in turtle coordinates (coordinate system x = -200..200 to right, y = -200..200 upward).
        Parameters:
        s - the step to move back, if s < 0 moves forward
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • bk

        public Turtle bk(double s)
        Short for back().

      • right

        public Turtle right(double angle)
        Turns the turtle to the right (clockwise).
        Parameters:
        angle - the turning angle (in degrees), if angle < 0 turns left
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

        public Turtle rt(double angle)
        Short for right().

        Turns the turtle to the left (counter clockwise).
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

        public Turtle lt(double angle)
        Short for left().

      • beep

        public static void beep()
        Emits a beep (1000 Hz sine wave of 100 ms duration). (This is a static method because it affects all turtles.)

      • getPopulationSize

        public static int getPopulationSize()
        Get the total number of turtles (the global turtle is not counted). (This is a static method because it affects all turtles.)
        Returns:
        the size of the Turtle population

      • clean

        public static void clean()
        Erases the playground by filling it with the current playground color. The turtles remain visible at their current position. (This is a static method because it affects all turtles.)

      • clean

        public static void clean(int color)
        Erases the playground by filling it with the given color. The turtles remain visible at their current position. (This is a static method because it affects all turtles.)

      • clear

        public static void clear()
        Clears the playground by filling it with the current playground color. All turtle images and traces are erased, but the turtles remain (hidden) at their current positions. Keep in mind that hiding the turtles sets their speed to MAXSPEED. (This is a static method because it affects all turtles.)

      • clear

        public static void clear(int color)
        Clears the playground by filling it with the given color. All turtle images and traces are erased, but the turtles remain (hidden) at their current positions. Keep in mind that hiding the turtles sets their speed to MAXSPEED. (This is a static method because it affects all turtles.)

      • hideTurtle

        public Turtle hideTurtle()
        Hides the turtle. The traces are still drawn, if pen is down. The turlte's speed is set to MAXSPEED in order to let it draw as quick as possible. Showing the turtle with showTurtle() does not affect the current speed.
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • ht

        public Turtle ht()
        Short for hideTurtle().

      • isHidden

        public boolean isHidden()
        Reports the current visibility of the turtle.
        Returns:
        true, if the turtle is currently hidden; otherwise false

      • showTurtle

        public Turtle showTurtle()
        Shows the turtle if it was hidden before. The turtle is put on top of all other turtles. The current speed is not modified.
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • st

        public Turtle st()
        Short for showTurtle().

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • getHeading

        public double getHeading()
        Returns the current heading (moving direction).
        Returns:
        the heading in degrees, 0 to north, clockwise

      • setHeading

        public Turtle setHeading(double heading)
        Sets the current heading (moving direction). If speed is not MAXSPEED, the turtle rotation is animated, it turns to left or right for the smaller angle.
        Parameters:
        heading - in degrees, 0 to north, clockwise
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

             double y)
        Returns the direction (heading) from the current position to the given position.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the target position
        y - the y coordinate of the target position
        Returns:
        the heading in degrees, 0 to north, clockwise

      • home

        public Turtle home()
        Puts the turtle at home (center of playground, coordinates (0, 0). The movement is not animated and no trace is drawn.
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • isPenDown

        public boolean isPenDown()
        Reports the current pen state of the turtle.
        Returns:
        true, if the pen is down, so traces are drawn; otherwise no traces are drawn

        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • setPos

        public Turtle setPos(double x,
            double y)
        Puts the turtle to the given position. The movement is not animated and no trace is drawn.
        Parameters:
        x - the new turtle's x coordinate
        y - the new turtle's y coordinate
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • moveTo

        public Turtle moveTo(double x,
            double y)
        Moves the turtle to the given position. If the speed is not MAXSPEED, the movement is animated: First the turtle turns to the new heading, then it moves forward.
        Parameters:
        x - the new turtle's x coordinate
        y - the new turtle's y coordinate
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • dot

        public Turtle dot()
        Draws a single point (dot) at the current turtle position using the current pen color.
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • setX

        public Turtle setX(double x)
        Puts the turtle to the given x coordinate. The y coordinate is maintained. The movement is not animated and no trace is drawn.
        Parameters:
        x - the new turtle's x coordinate
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • setY

        public Turtle setY(double y)
        Puts the turtle to the given y coordinate. The x coordinate is maintained. The movement is not animated and no trace is drawn.
        Parameters:
        y - the new turtle's y coordinate
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • sleep

        public static void sleep(int time)
        Delays the execution for the given time. If you want to stop the current turtle's movements, set its speed to 0. (This is a static method because it affects all turtles.)
        Parameters:
        time - the time to wait (in ms)

      • fill

        public Turtle fill(double x,
          double y)
        Fills a bounded region of the playground with the current pen color (flood fill). It is assumed that the region is colored with the current playground color. The current position of the turtle is not changed.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of a point inside the region
        y - the y coordinate of a point inside the region
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • fill

        public Turtle fill()
        Same as fill(x, y), but uses the current turtle position. If the turtle is sitting on its trace, a neighbor pixel with the playground color is searched.
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • getActor

        public turtle.Actor getActor()
        Returns the underlying turtle actor.
        Returns:
        the actor reference

      • isOnBorder

        public boolean isOnBorder()
        Returns true, if the turtle is on any of the 4 border lines.
        Returns:
        true, if one of the border lines intersects any of the non-transparent pixels of the turtle image

      • isOnBorder

        public boolean isOnBorder(int borderId)
        Returns true, if the turtle is on the selected border line.
        Parameters:
        borderId - 0: top border, 1: right border, 2: bottom border, 3: left border
        Returns:
        true, if the border line intersects any of the non-transparent pixels of the turtle image

      • isForwardValid

        public boolean isForwardValid(double s)
        Checks if the forward movement using the given step moves the turtle to a position outside the visible playground. The turtle's position remains unchanged.
        Parameters:
        s - the step to move forward, if s < 0 moves back
        Returns:
        true, if the turtle remains inside the playground; otherwise false

      • isBackValid

        public boolean isBackValid(double s)
        Checks if the backward movement using the given step moves the turtle to a position outside the visible playground. The turtle's position remains unchanged.
        Parameters:
        s - the step to move back, if s < 0 moves forward
        Returns:
        true, if the turtle remains inside the playground; otherwise false

      • fillToPoint

        public Turtle fillToPoint(double x,
                 double y)
        Attachs a imaginary rubber band between the turtle and the given anchor point. When the turtle now moves, the area covered by the rubber band is filled with the current pen color. Filling is on until fillOff() is called.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the anchor point
        y - the y coordinate of the anchor point
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • fillToHorizontal

        public Turtle fillToHorizontal(double y)
        Draws a imaginary horizonatal line at given y coordinate. When the turtle now moves, the trapezoidal area covered by this line and the turtle position is filled with the current pen color. Filling is on until fillOff() is called.
        Parameters:
        y - the y coordinate of the horizontal line
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • fillToVertical

        public Turtle fillToVertical(double x)
        Draws a imaginary vertical line at given x coordinate. When the turtle now moves, the trapezoidal area covered by this line and the turtle position is filled with the current pen color. Filling is on until fillOff() is called.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the vertical line
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • isInPlayground

        public boolean isInPlayground()
        Checks, if the turtle is inside or outside the playground.
        Returns:
        true, if the turtle is inside the playgroud; otherwise false

      • fillOff

        public Turtle fillOff()
        Stops the filling started by calling fillToPoint(), fillToHorizontal() or fillToVertical().
        Returns:
        the turtle reference to allow chaining

      • clone

        public Turtle clone()
        Creates a clone of the current turtle by performing a deep copy of all its properties. Can be used to "stamp" a turtle e.g. to create a fixed turtle image at the current location. The new turtle is put on top of other turtles.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a reference to the new turtle object
